question_title: Will the interest in “amber alert” change between 2026-02-02 and 2026-02-14 according to Google Trends?
summary: This question asks whether Google Trends interest in "amber alert" will change by more than ±3 points between Feb 2 and Feb 14, 2026. The current baseline is 19 (relatively low), suggesting a quiet period. Monte Carlo simulations with different volatility assumptions suggest "Doesn't change" is most likely (43%) due to status quo bias and low baseline volatility. However, "Increases" (32%) has meaningful probability because amber alerts cause unpredictable search spikes - a single high-profile alert could push values above the threshold. "Decreases" (25%) is less likely because the low baseline limits downward movement and spike events only push values upward. The 12-day window creates moderate uncertainty across all outcomes.

factors.description: Low baseline (19) indicates quiet period - favors stability and limits how much values can decrease
Amber alerts are event-driven with unpredictable spikes - asymmetric upward risk from potential high-profile alerts
12-day window with ±3 threshold creates moderate volatility exposure - enough time for drift or single event to matter
~6 amber alerts expected nationally in 12 days, but only ~15% cause significant national search spikes
No scheduled events or seasonal patterns affecting 'amber alert' searches in early February
Floor effect: with baseline at 19, limited room to decrease significantly before hitting natural floor (~5-10)
